intro: Cheirostylis seidenfadeniana, commonly known as the Siam orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial herb with a pseudobulb and long, linear leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with bright yellow flowers that have a unique, spurred lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
